title: Commending the Clarence Clubhouse Restoration Committee upon the occasion of their designation as recipient of the 2011 Organization of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  the  Clarence Clubhouse Restoration
Committee upon the occasion of their designation  as  recipient  of  the
2011  Organization  of  the  Year  Award  from  the  Clarence Chamber of
Commerce

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that  the
quality  and  character of life in the communities across New York State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those organiza-
tions and individuals who would devote themselves to the welfare of  the
community and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to commend the Clarence
Clubhouse  Restoration  Committee upon the occasion of their designation
as recipient of the  2011  Organization  of  the  Year  Award  from  the
Clarence  Chamber  of  Commerce,  to  be celebrated at its Annual Awards
Dinner on Thursday, February 24, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The  Clarence  Clubhouse  Restoration  Committee  (CCRC)  was
established  by Clarence Town Supervisor Kathleen Hallock in 2004; after
an open house with Doors Open Niagara, in 2003, she realized  that  many
organizations  like  Clarence  Contemporary  Club and Clarence Log Cabin
Quilters  were  quietly  making  improvements  at  the  clubhouse;  this
enthused  her to write a Supervisor Column in the CLARENCE BEE in Novem-
ber of 2003; and
  WHEREAS, Shortly afterwards, Kathleen Hallock invited  representatives
from  various  organizations  that use the clubhouse to meet and discuss
plans for its renovation, rejuvenation and restoring; and
  WHEREAS, Since the Committee's inception, many improvements have  been
accomplished  with  the  help of many local organizations, citizens, and
help from area businesses;  in  addition,  various  upgrades  have  been
provided by the town and the parks department; and
  WHEREAS,  Other  major  aesthetic  improvement  projects have been the
reupholstering and refinishing of the  original  furniture,  and  adding
carpeting,  painting  as  well  as  new curtains; the creation and frame
installation of the Bicentennial Quilt was a major addition to the  main
room by the Clarence Log Cabin Quilters; and
  WHEREAS, Since the purchase of the building and grounds in 1957 by the
Town of Clarence, from the Automobile Club of Buffalo, the Clarence Town
Park  Clubhouse  has served as an important town landmark that functions
as a symbol of its great heritage and serves as a central meeting  place
for  many community activities; in 2011, the Town of Clarence will cele-
brate this special landmark  by  hosting  a  Centennial  Celebration  in
conjunction with Day in the Park on July 2; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when organiza-
tions of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  the  Clarence Clubhouse Restoration Committee upon the occasion
of their designation as recipient of the 2011 Organization of  the  Year
Award from the Clarence Chamber of Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Clarence Clubhouse Restoration Committee.
